The first time I played this, I was Horrified (with a capital H) The second I escaped My heart was pumping and I wanted to scream and laugh because, what I just wittnessed was one of the hardest things I've done in a while and I just wanted to do more and more and more, and I did.
Personally, I view this as a great game. If you want a game where you feel like your in a actual horror movie and your one of the victims then this is a good game for you. If you want a game that allows you to murder all of your friends while also making creepy voices and acting like a crazed maniac then this game is right for you. Horror games dont really phase me that much, this game can be the few that can actually make me feel alive and terrified.

the game is definitely worth it, each time you enter the arena you never will have the same outcome and will have a variety of team mates ranging in skill levels with some being new and some being veterans all at complete random. The moment you are in, it is pandemonium and nerve wracking while you try and focus on the generators while avoiding a randomly skilled killer who also varies in skill depending on the player playing the killer. The only downside is that there is very little ability to communicate with the team except for the pre game screen in which you can talk and set up a game plan for what role you will take. What a great game! I love playing as The Trapper! So much fun chasing folks around (sometimes literally, around and around something!) and then slashing them with your homemade machette! Picking them up and hanging thme on a hook, set a trap or two around them and back to the hunt (no camping, survivors cry about it lol, although it is a legit tactic, its more fun to hunt others, hope that one gets away to catch again, more points). Yeah, the game has a few issues, what new game don't, especially one like this. But it is SO much fun!

This is the only steam game I asked for a refund of. Look at my library. Let that sink in. I don't care what promises the devs are making because this game as it is, outside of the performance and usability issues(which there are many), is mechanically broken and designed poorly. Which is a shame, because it's such a novel idea, just implemented poorly at every concievable level by poor development choices.
Great fun game but match making is broken for some reason

Feels like being thrown into an arena with a fork in your hand. One of the most frustrating experiences as gamer and I've been playing for 30+ years. The game lacks information almost on every department, for example, I received a daily task that i just simply don't know how to complete, then I found out that to do it I need very rare item, so I tried to move on, tried to cancel the daily quest but I can't because I don't know how, I tried reading the manual, visiting forums, playing the game for hours but the learning curve is extremely steep and you seem to be going to need hours and hours of experience to get good in the game and receive items that really make a difference.

If you play against people that know what they're doing, be prepared to lose in the most humiliating way possible. I just can't remember feeling so humiliated by a game in a very very long time. Just asked for a refund, but I know I will not get it, because I played it for nine hours trying to get a sense of the gameplay. What a terrible experience.
Great game! Its super fun if ur into survival horror type games, but if thats not ur thing or u get scared easily maybe its not for u.    10/10

It would be good if there was some variety in levels and gamemodes, but it really seems basic.

This game could be fun at times, definitely, but let me put you in perspective.

Dead by Daylight is a game that feels like cashing in on the Friday the 13th hype, there is so little polish and weird design choices that made me believe this game was churned out as fast as possible to make money as quick as possible rather than have a stable and perfectly functioning online multiplayer slasher 1v4 flick. You see, in this game, all everything revolves around is to spam the shift button and watch the ground, and pressing space for vaulting over stuff, or to block certain chokepoints with planks of wood. Not only is the matchmaking barebones as of current, it's hard to feel any sort of terror or horror into the game, although the devs did mention they are fixing matchmaking for the future, I'll credit them for it.

However, as I mentioned, that's 3 things you're going to be doing again and again after matches aside from the shitty qte generator fixing, maybe an extra couple or so once you've unlocked several new items which hardly makes it more fun, rather making matches last longer than its comfort zone, and if you've still thinking that I'm an idiot for critizing/not reccomending the game , here's a video you should definitely watch, I don't know about you, but I'd rather pay full price for something as good as this, rather than ten bucks for a game that's disguised under a murky color pallette to hide how insignificant the "Procedurally generated" world is, 


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Iz6e-64mj2Q&ab_channel=GunMedia

See that? Yeah, looks amazing, right? Well don't get overhyped before its release, but definitely keep an eye out for that game instead of this.
If there's anything to compare this game to, is that Dead By Daylight is very technically similar one of the better looking GMOD gamemodes with the same concept, and even then I've had more fun with Gmod gamemodes

In re-cap
The Alpha build for Friday the 13th makes Dead by Daylight look like a shoddy attempt to race them to the pot of gold, it's surprising how simple things missing in this game like doors makes it look 100% better, that kind of simple stuff is what creates this 'dynamic horror' feature, not a bunch of random pubs that have a 50% chance to troll you by dragging matches way longer than they should last.

Full of Euro or Chinese trash that can't afford more than 56k so either you're warping all over or they are. When you get players that don't lag the game is very fun, haven't ran into any glitches that were in the Beta like getting stuck in the boards as killer ect. Nor have I seen any hackers like you'd see in the Beta also, speed hacking mainly. I've been kinda bored so I picked this up after trying the Beta and the new killers are definately very fun to play especially the Hillbilly when you sprint with a chainsaw it's very fun and fast paced as long as you can keep the survivors on their toes.

As far as recommending this game YES if you want to add a decent game to your list but not if you want to play with friends and multiplayer that function is nonexistent. It's either friends or multisolo, can't mix the two.

For 18$ with the sale it's worth the buy in my opinion, I've just gotten tired of non americans playing games and peer to peer connections that are unstable and make the game play unbearable. Wish they would make most games region based to fix this issue. The main problem with me being a night owl is that I obviously get a lot of euros or chinese as hosts or to join my lobby and warp every two feet and it's hard to play either survivor or killer with this.

I dont write a lot of reviews, but with this game i just had to go out and talk about it. I bought this game and started playing it about 5 days ago, and I have been playing it hours and hours a day since then. This game is very intense and a ton of fun to play alone with random people, or with friends. I love the stealth aspect of the game when being a survivor, and hearing the music and heartbeating makes it so much more intense and scary. 

There are still a lot of bugs with the game, i notice it mostly when your dying and being rescued from the hook at the same time, your body can be floating above the ground on your screen but on other screens everything is normal. But, this is still a fairly new game and I'm sure that will get sorted out soon. Still a fun game none the less. 

One thing i would recommend is more character customizations and maps (im sure more will be added in the future anyways). One cool map idea would be inside an asylum or some big building with plenty of rooms, floors and a front/back door to escape. Being chased in corridors would be insanely intense and scary/fun!

This game...
Where do I even begin?

As a survivor, this game is nerve-wracking. You're constanly looking over your shoulder, listening, wondering... But you've gotta stay cool. One wrong move, and you're done. Especially if you've got an attentive, persistent killer on your tail. Which segways into my favorite aspect of the game: being the killer.
Literally everyone is your bitch. If you want them dead, they die. While you can bully one survivor while he's hung on a hook, your attention to only him/her will cost you dearly, as another survivor may activate a generator. You have to be brutal, but very aware of what's happening around you.
Sound is crucial to this game from both sides. If you don't have a headset, I recommend you get one before playing this.
10/10
Would slash again.

Honestly this game is really fun, but it has many downs. This game has muliple bugs that they are still fixing. The lobby connecing time and search is horrable. Its almost impossible to get a full lobby as a killer. The Killers dont have any real insentive to go hunting for other survivors as he is hook camping. Their is only one game mode and it still feels like this game is still in early beta since it still got a long way to go in updating. 

Youtubers and streamers got it easy since they got a fanbase and buddies to start a game with, but the ammount of dead air you have when you are solo queing is insane. 

Id recommend this game of you have a group of 5  friends including yourself to have a game with. But if not, save your money and look somewhere else till they actually have a completed product.

Enormously fun. A bit bare bones to be honest, so don't expect a huge amount in terms of variety, but it has very solid core gameplay that more can be built onto. 

There are a few issues:

 As other reviews have said there is no way to play a match with friends unless you can fill the full five-men. 

You can't choose your host, and so it's up to the will of the gods as to whether or not you'll get one with decent ping. 

There are a few bugs and exploits that are running crazy right now, including things like disconnections not being counted by the ranked system and therefore high level players are disconnecting at the slightest hint of losing. 

Finally the survivors are a bit broken. Though the maps are randomly generated, anyone who plays them a few times will come to know the sections where a survivor can abuse their wall-jumping speed to constantly hop back and forth over the same wall. A pursuing killer would then either have to run back and forth hoping that they mess up, or give up and hunt other prey. Luckily this is going to be patched, but hasn't yet. 

So yeah, it is not perfect, but it's fun. Ludicrous, terrifying, exhilirating fun. 8/10 would buy again.
i really want to play the game but i cant because i need DX11 to play the game

i like the idea of the game, but the pace is a bit too slow for me. At the moment I find that the only real way to succeed is to not give a crap about your team mates and just repair generators and get the hell away :P

I suppose thats how it "should" be, but it doesnt make for a very entertaining game in the long run (for me, anyway). The reward for trying to rescue a team mate is just not worth it. Especially not if the Killer is a real camper :)
In that case you just merrily go about your business and start generators while the Killer is busy guarding that 1 poor sod who was stabbed in the back 1 minute into the game :(
Sometimes you're lucky and the hooked victim decides to spam his <space> button and tries to struggle to resist the Entity as its stabby bits close in upon his poor head... That gives YOU more time to do your stuff, while the Killer impatiently taps his foot waiting for the guy to give up and die so he can go out and find more people.

I recommend the game for its concept and the polish of it. The gameplay and matchmaking needs work, but I'm hoping things become better in the near future :)
Game has some lagging issues a bit but over all, 5/5

This game, even through all the cons that people are listing, is still really fun.  DC'ers, Vault Spammers, Ranks (Which if you just play the game for fun, doesn't matter.  My character is lvl 23 now, I've only been down to Rank 18 as my lowest, because regardless of me winning or losing I still had a great time.), lag, etc.  Like 90% of the cons people are listing are on their way to being in a patch, but until then, I still get my heart racing in a lot of games that are perfectly fine.  People just need patience and need to mellow out, the night is always darkest before the dawn.

Side note: I can't remember what movie I heard that last line from, but it sounded good in my head when I was trying to conclude my review.  lol
